eg.javatools

Class Compilation

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.javatools.Compilation

  • public class Compilation
extends java.lang.Object
    The compilation of java files using the Java Compiler API

        Returns the boolean that indicates if java files were compiled successfully

        public java.lang.String firstCompileErr()
        Returns the shortened error message which indicates the source file and the line number in the first listed compilation error
        Returns:
        the message or the empty empty string if there is none

        Returns if messages of a kind other than error are present
        Returns:
        the boolean value which is true if messages are present

        Returns:

      • optionErr

        public java.lang.String optionErr()
        Returns the error message that indicates that the input for the Xlint compiler option is invalid
        Returns:
        the message or the empty string of there is none

      • compile

        public void compile(java.lang.String root,
                    java.lang.String execDir,
                    java.lang.String sourceDir,
                    java.lang.String[] nonJavaExt,
                    java.lang.String xlintOption)
        Invokes the javac compiler
        Parameters:
        root - the root directory of the java project
        execDir - the name of the destination directory for the compiled class files/packages. Can be the empty string if nonJavaExt is null.
        sourceDir - the name of the directory that contains java files/ packages. Can be the empty string if nonJavaExt is null.
        nonJavaExt - the array of extensions of files that are copied to the compilation. Requires that both a sources and a classes directory is present. May be null.
        xlintOption - the Xlint compiler option. Other compiler options are ignored.
